choices.A: Go to Application Properties and set "Refer to page by name (or alias)" to "Yes".
choices.C: Enter an alphanumeric name in the Page Title attribute.
choices.D: Enter an alphanumeric alias in the Page Alias attribute.
choices.B: Set the Built-in substitution string PAGE_ALIAS on page load.

questions.question_text:
You want to refer to a page by a name (or alias) instead of page number in the application URL.
Which step most accurately helps you achieve this?
Which processing point is enabled for computations during page processing?

discussion.content: "The most typical computation point is After Submit." => B

questions.question_text:
Michael created a report and form on a table to maintain customers.
When Michael tested the new form and entered a new record, he got this error:
//IMG//

What should Michael do to resolve this issue?

choices.B: Add a trigger on the table to populate the CUSTOMER_ID column when null.
choices.D: Set the Customer ID item to text field with Read-Only set to "Always".
choices.A: Select Managed by Database (ROWID) for the Primary Key type.

questions.question_text:
In Application Express, how do you enable a database schema assigned to the current workspace so that it can be used to serve ORDS-based RESTful
Services?

discussion.content: C, but hard to figure out if you are not a system admin.

choices.A: Install the Sample REST Services packaged application.
choices.D: Navigate to workspace administration and in the Set Workspace Preferences section, set Enable RESTful Services to "Yes".
choices.C: Navigate to the ORDS RESTful services section of SQL workshop, select the appropriate schema, and click the "Register Schema with ORDS" button.
choices.B: Navigate to the Shared Components section and configure a REST Enabled SQL resource.

questions.question_text:
Jenny has a form page based on ORDER_ITEMS. For certain product types, she needs to redirect to a modal dialog page to ask for additional information, before validating or processing the record on page submission.
Which processing point should Jenny select for the branch?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
This question seems to need an update. Oracle has change the options through the years. Some of the lastest (v23.1) are:
- After Submit (previously named Before Computation)
- Validating (previously named Before Validation)
- Processing (previously named Before Processing)

So this answer could be A or C.

https://docs.oracle.com/en/database/oracle/apex/23.1/htmdb/controlling-navigation-using-branches.html#GUID-09D6B7B0-25FE-4F36-A573-582FE605CB2C

After Submit
Processing: Branches after submitting the page and before computation, validations and processes are executed.

The answer is A:
On Submit: Before Computation - Branching occurs before computations, validations, or processing. Use this option for buttons that should not invoke processing (for example, a Cancel button).
https://docs.oracle.com/database/apex-5.1/HTMDB/controlling-navigation-using-branches.htm#HTMDB28485
the answer is B i guess , Refer ( https://docs.oracle.com/database/apex-5.1/HTMDB/controlling-navigation-using-branches.htm#HTMDB30018)
the answer is C after submit
The correct answer should be C "After Submit".
